references.paper_title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational for graph neural networks (GNNs), providing the basis for many subsequent GNN architectures and applications discussed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Infobatch: Lossless training speed up by unbiased dynamic data pruning
references.reason: This is a state-of-the-art data pruning method used as a baseline and compared against the proposed method in the paper, highlighting its significance in the field.

references.paper_title: Open graph benchmark: Datasets for machine learning on graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces a widely used benchmark dataset (OGBG) employed in the experiments, validating the generalizability of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Batch normalization: Accelerating deep network training by reducing internal covariate shift
references.reason: This is a highly influential paper in deep learning, providing techniques used to improve training stability and efficiency, relevant to the context of the current study.

references.paper_title: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of residual networks, which have significantly improved the performance of deep learning models across various tasks, including those involving graphs.
